body.p: [Wilde expresses gratitude for Nelson’s kindness at Reading Gaol.]
[Reflects on gratitude, suffering, and the emotional impact of imprisonment.]
[Discusses the publication of his open letter on the “Martin” case.]
[Mentions conditions in prison and his sympathy for fellow inmates.]
[States he is not ashamed of prison, only of the materialistic life that led him there.]
[Ends by calling himself Nelson’s sincere and grateful friend.]

closer.signed: Your sincere and grateful friend, Oscar Wilde
